meanings.sent1: The old abandoned house looked spooky in the moonlight.
meanings.sent2: The children found the dark forest to be spooky.
meanings.sent3: The spooky noises coming from the attic turned out to be just a family of raccoons.
meanings.sent4: The spooky shadows danced on the walls, creating an atmosphere of mystery.
meanings.sent5: The spooky movie kept me on the edge of my seat with its eerie scenes.

meanings.sent1: The spooky sound of footsteps behind her made Sarah shiver.
meanings.sent2: The spooky stories around the campfire made everyone huddle closer.
meanings.sent3: The spooky mask made Tim jump in surprise at the Halloween party.
meanings.sent4: The spooky fog enveloped the town, spreading a sense of unease.
meanings.sent5: The spooky creaking of the door sent a chill down her spine.

meanings.definition: Suggestive of ghosts or the supernatural
meanings.sent1: The spooky mist that hovered over the graveyard gave it an eerie feel.
meanings.sent2: The spooky legend of the haunted castle intrigued the tourists.
meanings.sent3: The spooky costume party was filled with fake ghosts and witches.
meanings.sent4: The spooky aura of the old mansion hinted at a ghostly presence.
meanings.sent5: The spooky tales of the paranormal kept the children wide-eyed with wonder.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a feeling of dread or apprehension
meanings.sent1: The spooky silence in the dark alley made her heart race.
meanings.sent2: The spooky music in the horror movie set a tense atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The spooky feeling of being watched made him quicken his pace.
meanings.sent4: The spooky anticipation of the unknown outcome kept her on edge.
meanings.sent5: The spooky premonition of danger lingered in the air, causing unease.
